divs: sighting detailsi recall was when i was about 14 years old. my father and i were living the batchlor life as my mom was hospitalized with tb and my sisters were living with relatives. we lived about 1.5 miles to the north of the small town of miston, tn and on the banks of a bayou. as we had no inside toilet, it was dad's habit to stand on the back porch and urinate into the bayou if he needed to go during the night. on this occasion, he came back inside and woke me and without telling me why, he told me to come outside. once i was on the back porch, he told me to look toward the southeast and tell him what i saw. approximately 3\4 of a mile from the house and above a forested area was a large object that seemed to just float silently. there were glowing circles (windows) along the side of the object, which i can now describe as being about the size of two boeing e4bs (747) fitted nose to nose and without the wings and vertical fins. at that time there was nothing that i knew with which to compare it. i could not tell if it had the classic saucer shape, as it was at a very low angle. it did have the domed top, which is why i describe it as looking similar to two 747s, and it glowed enough to light the the trees beneath it so that their branches were clearly visible. there appeared to be no movement, as it just sat there above the trees, and there was absolutely no sound, as it was a very quiet night in the country. we watched it for what seemed like a long time, but then, it was quite cold and i was lightly clad so we were probably there for 5-6 minutes, after which the object seemed to move up and away rather quickly. at no time did he prompt me in any way as to what was there and neither of us ever spoke to anyone about seeing it as, in those days, we would have been considered to be mentally unstable. note: the boeing e4b has an additional hump on top of the normal 747 bulge. just imagine two such aircraft trimmed and fitted together so that they have a double bulge on top, but minus the wings and tailfeathers. william e. ray msgt usaf ret. private pilot retired boeing technician
